row.cell: Shekelleme made us a presant of half a Dear. gave it hartily.
had a Still Sweet Sabbath felt in per=ticuler our Lambs peace. offer'd him our Worthless poor Hearts. beg'd him to take and keep us as Rewards of His paine.
in the Evening two Dellaware Desir'd Room for a Bundle of things. we refus'd it fearing others Shud Demand unto whom thay Did not belong
Bro. & Sister Smith went a visiting found verry few at hom.
Shekellame ask'd Powell if hee'd make him a larg fence. Said hee'd pay in Skins. tould him Powel had not time

came two Traders down the river cal.d of Shekellame but came not to us. we see that tho we behave friend-dly towards the Traders yet when one happens to come in our hous hees as a fish out of water. thank our Lord thay trouble us so little
had Severall visi.. Some Indians we had not before Seen. Sum have no corn at all & cannot by with Skins But are oblig'd first to chang them for Brandy or with that by Corn
